function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of protection and improvement of the environment","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of environmental protection leading to the spread of contagious diseases","category":"Water","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inefficient use of ecological resources leading to environmental degradation","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Employment of engineering techniques to reduce the spread of covid-19","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of thermal scanning technology to detect covid-19 symptoms.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Slow temperature screening process","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on lighting conditions for temperature measurement","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence of uv doses on type of organism and hard surface","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of biophilic design and healing environments","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on the impact of contagious diseases in the built environment","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unclear or unsupported factual statements about contagious diseases in the built environment","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Unbalanced or unjustified conclusions about disease propagation in the built environment","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Ineffective or impractical solutions for real-world challenges related to disease containment in the built environment","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of planning and design for pandemics","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of physical distancing in urban areas","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of contagious diseases in urban areas due to high density and travel","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential impact of pandemic diseases on urban planning and design","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Discrepancies in disease spread based on health and urban space quality levels","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Digital domination over physical infrastructure","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Integration of work and living spaces may increase the risk of disease transmission within the home environment.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"New living and working patterns may lead to inadequate building and infrastructure standards for disease prevention.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of contagion due to changing spatial patterns and requirements in the post pandemic era.","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in urban settings due to dense population and close proximity.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of disease within the city’s urban structure due to movement patterns and commuting","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Emphasis on walking as a mode of transportation can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases in densely populated residential areas.","category":"Mobility Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Environmental changes and ecosystem complexity related to human activities","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of functioning restrooms in parks","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Bringing activities to open green spaces without proper planning may lead to increased risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate protocol, staff, and equipment for managing limited access and monitoring compliance in green spaces","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of controlled access to parks contributing to increased virus spread due to crowd movement and unsupervised access to open parks.","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close proximity within the white circles could lead to increased spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access and multiple entry points may lead to inconsistent enforcement of mask-wearing and temperature checks, increasing the risk of contagious disease spread.","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of personnel to monitor protocol compliance","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate resources for maintaining safe park environments","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of biodiversity protection in urban green spaces","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of public restrooms in municipal green spaces","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on iot for realtime monitoring may lead to system failures, causing hazardous conditions to go undetected.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Greater interaction with the physical world through iot increases the risk of cyber attacks and unauthorized access to iaq monitoring systems.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low performance of non-iot based iaq monitoring systems","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges with sensor calibration and practical implementation","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Wsn based systems using zig-bee as the communication protocol","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High latency in wsn-based iaq monitoring systems","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Iot based systems for iaq monitoring","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to volatile organic compounds vocs such as xylene, ethylbenzene, toluene, and benzene in the built environment","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate monitoring of indoor air quality iaq leading to potential health risks for residents","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weaknesses in existing iaq monitoring systems leading to unreliable data and potential health risks for residents","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of sensors without proper calibration could lead to inaccurate measurements of iaq parameters.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to reduce computational burden of sensing nodes may lead to shorter battery life of the monitoring system.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low-cost iaq monitor may have limited accuracy and reliability, leading to incorrect measurements of pollutants.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and pollutant levels may go unnoticed due to limited monitoring parameters.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"}]}
